riddles.question: I go up but never come down. What am I?
I’m full of holes but I can hold water. What am I?
What planet is known as the Red Planet?
What do you call the force that keeps you on the ground?
I’m not alive, but I can grow. I don’t have lungs, but I need air. What am I?
I have a face and two hands, but no arms or legs. What am I?
You use me to see things far away. What am I?
What gas do plants breathe in that humans breathe out?
I change shapes, sometimes solid, liquid, or gas. What am I?
What tool do scientists use to look at really tiny things?
I shine at night but I'm not the moon. What am I?
What do you call an animal that lived long ago and is now extinct?
I help you add and subtract, I'm small and smart. What am I?
I’m the hottest planet in the solar system. What am I?
I help plants make food from sunlight. What am I?
I go up but never come down. What am I?
I’m full of holes but I can hold water. What am I?
